title: Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX)
description: Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX) the Windows work stations are used as X terminals and to run Eclipse (since PC are cheaper than Unix boxes).
OB: Currently, when creating a new file on Windows work stations using Eclipse, the default line delimiters for the new file are based on the Windows platform, resulting in Windows line delimiters being used.
EB: The expected behavior is that even if the new file is created on Windows, it should have Unix line delimiters, since the end product is a Unix product. There should be a UI (Preference) provided by the Workbench to define the line delimiter for new files. The UI should allow users to choose from the following possible values: Dos / Windows, Mac, Unix, or the default platform line delimiter. This UI should be consistent across all plugins.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Launch Eclipse on a Windows work station.
2. Create a new file.
3. Check the line delimiters used for the newly created file.
